p: The B. occulta oleo-gum-resins and commercial Boswellia carteri essential oils were analyzed by GC-MS with a Shimadzu GCMS-QP2010 Ultra with ZB-5 capillary column as previously described [ 25]. Identification of the chemical components was carried out by comparison of the retention indices determined with respect to a homologous series of normal alkanes and our comparison of their mass spectra with those reported in the literature [ 44] and our own in-house library [ 45].
